Constructor & Destructor Documentation

std::sudoku::Board::Board (   ) 
 

Constructor for a sudoku Board.

Initialises the lists of columns, rows and boxes with empty dynamically allocated Cells. Note that each cell is pointed by one column, one row and one box.

Definition at line 503 of file sudoku.cpp.

References Boxes, Cols, and Rows.

std::sudoku::Board::Board (  Board *  solution,
short unsigned int  solvedCells = 30
) 
 

Constructor for a random sudoku board.

Creates randomly a solveable game.

  • solution Board where the solution to this random game will be stored
  • solvedCells Nomber of cells solved in the created game

std::sudoku::Board::~Board (   ) 
 

Destructor fro a sudoku Board.

Dynamically deallocate Board cells, which had been allocated in the constructor call.

Line & std::sudoku::Board::getCol (  short unsigned int  i  )  throw (domain_error) [inline]
 

Accessor to Board Columns.

This can be easily used together with the accessor to Line elements to access directly to Board elements doing myBoard[col][row].

  • i col index to be accesed.
    Returns:
    Requested Column reference.
    Exceptions:
    domain_error Thrown if 'i' is not within the range [0,8]
